metadata.case_name: Sub-Registrar v. State of Uttar Pradesh

facts.text: Appellant was in the service of the State of Uttar Pradesh as Sub-Registrar. Born on December 11, 1905 and recruited in July 1933.
At the time of recruitment, age of retirement for government servants of his class was 55 years. Normally should have retired on December 11, 1960.
By notification dated November 27, 1957, Government of Uttar Pradesh raised age of retirement to 58 years. Appellant would have retired on December 11, 1963.
On May 25, 1961, Government reduced age of retirement to 55 years by notification under Art. 309 of the Constitution.

Proviso added: Government servant who had not retired on or before June 17, 1957 but subsequently attained age of 55 years and has on May 25, 1961 not attained age of 58 years shall be deemed to have been retained in service beyond age of 55 years.

Another order issued same day by Governor with Schedule: Servants crossed 57 years on May 25, 1961 retained up to 58 years or Dec 31, 1961 earlier; crossed 55 but not 57 retained to Dec 31, 1961; crossing 55 between May 25 and Dec 30 retained to Dec 31, 1961.
Appellant, having crossed 55 before May 25, 1961 but not 57, retired on December 31, 1961.
Ram Autar Pandey filed writ petition challenging reduction; dismissed by Full Bench Allahabad High Court on December 21, 1961.
Present petition filed December 4, 1961; dismissed March 29, 1962 following Ram Autar Pandey; Division Bench appeal dismissed; certificate granted for Supreme Court appeal.

legal_issues.text: Whether change in retirement age by notification of May 25, 1961 hit by Art. 311 as amounting to removal without complying with requirements.
Whether the rule was retrospective and therefore bad, as no retrospective notification could be made.
Whether the rule hit by Art. 14 as resulting in inequality between public servants in matter of retirement.

petitioner_arguments.text: Change in rule of retirement amounted to removal under Art. 311 without complying with requirements. Reliance on Moti Ram Deka v. General Manager, North Frontier Railway.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Art. 311; Moti Ram Deka v. General Manager, North Frontier Railway

petitioner_arguments.text: Rule retrospective as per proviso, and no retrospective rule can be made.
Rule discriminatory under Art. 14 as public servants retired at different ages due to second notification.

court_reasoning.text: Rule relates to age of superannuation; termination on reaching superannuation age not 'removal' under Art. 311. Moti Ram Deka distinguished as it did not deal with retirement age; explicitly stated superannuation not removal.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Government has power to increase or reduce age of superannuation; no provision takes it away.

court_reasoning.text: No retrospectivity; rule applies from May 25, 1961 onwards like 1957 rule. Proviso deems service post-55 as retention to address prior rule change; second order avoids immediate dislocation, no one retired before May 25.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Proviso and second notification tide over public service difficulties.

court_reasoning.text: No discrimination in rule itself; fixes Dec 31, 1961 retirement for those over 55 not 58. Different ages due to varying retention periods post-55 based on efficiency and exigencies of service, not arbitrary.
court_reasoning.key_observation: All similarly situated retired on same date; differences from exigencies of public service.

holdings.text: Art. 311 has no application to termination by reduction in superannuation age.
No violation of Art. 14; no discrimination.

precedents_cited.case_name: Moti Ram Deka v. General Manager, North Frontier Railway
precedents_cited.relevance: Dealt with termination by notice, not retirement age; clarified superannuation not removal under Art. 311.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ram Autar Pandey v. State of U.P.
precedents_cited.relevance: Dismissed challenge to same reduction in retirement age.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Art. 309 power to issue notification on retirement age; Art. 311 not attracted; Art. 14 no discrimination.

outcome.summary: Appeal dismissed; upheld reduction in retirement age to 55 years via May 25, 1961 notifications and appellant's retirement on Dec 31, 1961; rejected all constitutional challenges.

key_quotes.text: a rule as to superannuation or retirement or as to compulsory retirement shortly before the age of superannuation resulting in the termination of service of a public servant did not amount to removal.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Distinguishes retirement from removal under Art. 311.

key_quotes.text: The retention of public servants after the period of retirement depends upon their efficiency and the exigencies of public service.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains lack of discrimination in varying retention periods.
